Globaltrans Investment Plc, a company organized and existing under the laws of of the Republic of Cyprus together with its subsidiaries (GTI) is the largest privately owned freight rail group operating in Russia; second only to state-owned Russian Railways (RZD) and its affiliates by number of owned rolling stock. The GTIs core activities are (i) freight rail transportation, (ii) railcar leasing, and (iii) certain ancillary services provided in Russia, the CIS countries and the Baltics. The project provides for acquisition of gondola (open top) cars (the Project) by GTIs 100% owned subsidiaries: Sevtekhnotrans (STT) and/or New Forwarding Company (NFC).

name.narrative: The Project is aligned with the GTIs strategy of return oriented expansion of its fleet. The GTIs extensive rolling stock fleet accounting for over 36,000 units as of January 2010 comprises several types of railcars, including gondola (open top) cars prevailing in the fleet, rail tank cars, flat platform cars and hopper cars. The new gondola (open top) cars will be used for the GTIs operations in Russia.
